FAIL_TO_PASS: when negatable boolean flag not specified then value is true
when program has unknown option before operands then all unknown in same order
when command-argument is -123.45 then consumed=true
when negated option then option included in helpInformation
when specify unknown option with subcommand and action handler then error
when option defined with --word-word then option property is wordWord
when digit option defined and command-argument is -1.2e+3 then negative not consumed
when program has mixed arguments then known options removed and rest returned in same order
when option-argument for short optional is -x-1 then consumed=false
when parseAsync called and parsed args later changed then parameter does not change
when option-argument for short optional... is 1 then consumed=true
when program has flag after subcommand then option removed
when passed string then treat as boolean
when helpOption(true) after false then helpInformation does include --help
when shared option before sub and after sub and after sub parameter then all three parsed
when required option-argument and default number then value is default
when has conflicting option then throw CommanderError
when default writeErr() then error on stderr
when just implicit help option returns length of help flags
when call subcommand then option values reset (program and subcommand)
